attributes.action: To call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in North Yorkshire County Council
attributes.additional_details:
An application to carry out fracking in England for the first time since a ban was lifted in 2012 has been approved.
North Yorkshire County Council considered a bid by Third Energy to extract shale gas at a site near Kirby Misperton in Ryedale.
Hundreds of protestors had attended a meeting in Northallerton to voice anger at the project, which was previously recommended for approval.
Councillors on the council's planning committee voted 7-4 in favour.
attributes.background: Today North Yorkshire County Council voted against massive public opinion to allow a fracking licence be granted for Kirby Misperton in North Yorkshire. Over 99% of the public in Ryedale have said no to fracking. This shows that the elected body of NYCC do not represent the people.

rejection.details:
This petition has been rejected because the UK Government or Parliament can't pass a motion of no confidence in a local council, this is something that the elected local Councillors could do. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 
 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Another petition has been created which addresses the substantive issue you raise in you petition - fraking in North Yorkshire (https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/131208). You may wish to consider signing this petition.
